title: Making Meaning: A Studio Approach to Teaching and Learning (Multiday Teacher Workshop)
hero_caption: <p>A participant in last year's Making Meaning Summer Institute.</p>
description:
>Three-Day Workshop: July 31, August 1, 2

>What goes on in students’ minds when they make art? What thought processes are put in motion through material manipulation, design, and aesthetic engagement? Learn by doing in this three-day workshop and discover how art making promotes the application of prior knowledge, innovation, analysis, problem solving, evaluation, and other critical thinking skills. Explore a variety of media to reflect on making and learning. No special skills are required, only an open mind and a willingness to experiment.

dir="ltr">This program will focus on the exhibition Cauleen Smith: Human_3.0 Reading List.

>One graduate credit will be offered for this program for an additional $100. E-mail teacherworkshops@artic.edu to learn more about this option.

>

>
For additional Teacher Workshops please visit the Teacher Programs Calendar.

>If you have any questions or special needs, please call (312) 443-9092 or e-mail teacherworkshops@artic.edu.
